Detailed Description

This class defines the abstract class stPageManager. All classes that provide page management service to the SlimTree must extend this class.

Version
1.0
Author
Fabio Jun Takada Chino (chino.nosp@m.@icm.nosp@m.c.usp.nosp@m..br)
Marcos Rodrigues Vieira (mrvie.nosp@m.ira@.nosp@m.icmc..nosp@m.usp..nosp@m.br)

Member Function Documentation

virtual void stPageManager::DisposePage ( stPage *  page)
pure virtual

Disposes the given page. This method will make the page available (not allocated) for the next calls of GetNewPage().

Since this page will not be used anymore, this method will release the lock for this page instance.

Parameters
pageThe page to be disposed.
See also
GetNewPage()

Implemented in stDiskPageManager, stPlainDiskPageManager, stMemoryPageManager, and stClientPageManager.

long int stPageManager::GetAccessCount ( )
inline

Returns the total page access. This value is the sum of the read count and write count.

Definition at line 255 of file stPageManager.h.

virtual stPage* stPageManager::GetHeaderPage ( )
pure virtual

Returns the header page. This method will return a special page that will be used by SlimTree to write some information about the tree itself.

Since this page must always exist, this method will always return a valid page for reading/writing. Use WritePage() to write this page.

The returning instance of stPage will be locked to prevent its reuse by this page manager. Use ReleasePage() to unlock this instance.

Returns
The header page.
See also
WritePage()
ReleasePage()

Implemented in stDiskPageManager, stPlainDiskPageManager, stMemoryPageManager, and stClientPageManager.

virtual stSize stPageManager::GetMinimumPageSize ( )
pure virtual

Returns the minimum size of a page. The size of the header page is always ignored since it may be smaller than others.

Implemented in stDiskPageManager, stPlainDiskPageManager, stMemoryPageManager, and stClientPageManager.

virtual stPage* stPageManager::GetNewPage ( )
pure virtual

Allocates a new page for use. As GetPage() and GetHeaderPage(), the returning instance will be locked to prevent reuse by this page manager.

To dispose this page (make it free), use DisposePage().

Returns
A new page or NULL for errors.
See also
ReleasePage()
WritePage()
DisposePage()

Implemented in stDiskPageManager, stPlainDiskPageManager, stMemoryPageManager, and stClientPageManager.

virtual stPage* stPageManager::GetPage ( stPageID  pageid)
pure virtual

Returns the page with the given page ID. This method will return a valid page for reading/writing. Use WritePage() to write this page.

The returning instance of stPage will be locked to prevent its reuse by this page manager. Use ReleasePage() to unlock this instance.

Parameters
pageidThe desired page id.
Returns
The page or NULL for an invalid page ID.
See also
WritePage()
ReleasePage()

Implemented in stDiskPageManager, stPlainDiskPageManager, stMemoryPageManager, and stClientPageManager.

Definition at line 247 of file stPageManager.h.

virtual bool stPageManager::IsEmpty ( )
pure virtual

This method will checks if this page manager is empty. If this method returns true, the stSlimTree will create a new tree otherwise it will continue to use the existing tree.

Returns
True if the page manager is empty or false otherwise.

Implemented in stDiskPageManager, stPlainDiskPageManager, stMemoryPageManager, and stClientPageManager.

virtual void stPageManager::ReleasePage ( stPage *  page)
pure virtual

Releases this instace for reuse by this page manager. Since some implementations of page manager will reuse instances of stPage to avoid unnecessary resource reallocations, each page instance must be locked until it becomes unecessary.

The stSlimTree will always call this method when a stPage instance will not be used in a near future.

Parameters
pageThe locked page.
See also
GetPage()
GetHeaderPage()

Implemented in stDiskPageManager, stPlainDiskPageManager, stMemoryPageManager, and stClientPageManager.

Referenced by stDummyTree< ObjectType, EvaluatorType >::~stDummyTree().

Definition at line 281 of file stPageManager.h.

virtual void stPageManager::WriteHeaderPage ( stPage *  headerpage)
inlinevirtual

This method writes the header page back to the page manager.

The default implementation calls the WritePage() to header page. If a page manager needs a special way to write the header page, this method must be overwritten.

As WritePage() do, this method do not releases the header page. You must call ReleasePage() to release it.

Parameters
headerpageThe header page.

Reimplemented in stDiskPageManager, and stPlainDiskPageManager.

Definition at line 123 of file stPageManager.h.

References WritePage().

virtual void stPageManager::WritePage ( stPage *  page)
pure virtual

Writes the given page to the disk. This method will write the page but will not release it. Use ReleasePage() to do it.

Parameters
pageThe page to be written.
See also
ReleasePage()
WriteHeaderPage()

Implemented in stDiskPageManager, stPlainDiskPageManager, stMemoryPageManager, and stClientPageManager.

Referenced by WriteHeaderPage().
